page.title: 01MELTON MOWBRAY
page.content:
Melton Mowbray lies 15 miles to the north-east of Leicester, in the valley of the river Eye, at the foot of the Wolds.
'Melton' either means a mill tun or a middle tun - a 'tun' being a Saxon word for a settlement with a woooden pallisade around it. The 'Mowbray' part of the name came much later, around 1125,from Roger de Mowbray who was Lord of the manor.
Melton Mowbray has become famous for Stilton cheese and pork pies, the petfoood manufacturers Pedigree Petfoods and the new coal mine at Asfordby which is 2 miles to the west of Melton Mowbray
The population of Melton Mowbray in the 1981 census was 23,592.
